__e: I know, m'lady, and I'm very sorry.
I know, m'lady, and I feel most uncomfortable but...
Believe me when I say we are here for your benefit, my lady, ~ and yours alone.
I was a housemaid then, m'lady, and I was starting to feel it was time to move on.
I'm sorry, my lady, but I can't do more than my best.
I know I don't sound very experienced, m'lady, but I'm a very hard worker and I've practised what I've learned.
It doesn't, m'lady. It's nothing to do with Lord Gillingham himself.
No. No, it's not that, it's my heart! Your heart?
Of course I can't, m'lady, not without asking Lady Mary.
